claim.text: A single household furnace runs at 80-95% efficiency
claim.claim: Household furnaces operate at 80-95% efficiency

results.summary: The 80-95% efficiency range for household furnaces accurately reflects standard AFUE ratings for modern gas furnaces.
results.detail: Household gas furnaces are rated by Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency (AFUE). Standard efficiency furnaces typically operate at 80% AFUE, while high-efficiency condensing furnaces achieve 90-98% AFUE. The U.S. Department of Energy has set minimum efficiency standards of 80% for non-condensing furnaces. The claimed range of 80-95% accurately captures the typical operating efficiency of modern residential furnaces.
sources: U.S. Department of Energy efficiency standards (based on training knowledge)
